wiki.summary: “Back to Love” is the second single released from Chris' upcoming album, Indigo, and is the follow up to January 2019’s “Undecided.” The track describes a pure love, with its ups and downs, that ultimately made Chris want to be the best version of himself. The artwork, music video, and song are all heavily influenced by Chris' biggest musical inspiration, Michael Jackson. Some of MJ’s signature ad-libs can be heard in the background throughout the song Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: “Back to Love” is the second single released from Chris' upcoming album, Indigo, and is the follow up to January 2019’s “Undecided.” The track describes a pure love, with its ups and downs, that ultimately made Chris want to be the best version of himself. The artwork, music video, and song are all heavily influenced by Chris' biggest musical inspiration, Michael Jackson. Some of MJ’s signature ad-libs can be heard in the background throughout the song, and Chris' dance moves and outfit (depicted in the artwork) in the video mimic the icon. The track was first teased on January 23rd when Chris posted a video on Instagram of him dancing to it, working on the choreography for the music video. The music video was filmed in Paris, France after Chris was detained in Paris over an alleged rape. On April 2nd, Chris shared a picture from the music video via Instagram and confirmed the video will drop on April 12, 2019. The single dropped one day early on streaming sites, along with its accompanying music video. Read more on Last.fm.
